string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111001101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="12" FirstLineMargin="12" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="20" SpacingBefore="6" SpacingAfter="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" Start="0" Color="#BB2A48" Size="100" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Assistant Professor Benny Bloom has just been given a last-minute contract to teach a hybrid class.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="12" FirstLineMargin="12" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="20" SpacingBefore="6" SpacingAfter="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" Start="0" Color="#BB2A48" Size="100" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="The class is 50% F2F and 50% online and will meet twice a week, once in the classroom and “once” online. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="12" FirstLineMargin="12" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="20" SpacingBefore="6" SpacingAfter="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" Start="0" Color="#BB2A48" Size="100" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Work with your colleague to help professor Bloom choose the best activities and assessments to meet his learning objectives so that his students do well on the final exam! There’s no time to lose!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="There are 2 boards you will use to help professor Bloom plan his class. The lesson plan board and the game board.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="There are 4 types of cards that you will use to play this game: Objective, Activity, Assessment and Chance.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Shuffle each deck of cards and place them on the corresponding squares on the game board. The discard square will be empty until you have a card to discard.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="To start the game, you will choose your objectives. Shuffle the cards in the objectives pile again and have each player take turns drawing an objective card and placing it on the Lesson Plan Board in the Objective squares. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You should discuss with your colleague which objectives would be better met online and which should be done face-to-face. You might also think about scaffolding your objectives if you can make any connections between them.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="You will only have 10 minutes to select your objectives so discuss with your colleague but do it quickly!
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Once you have drawn and placed your objectives, place the rest of the objective cards back on the game board in the objectives pile. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Select your game pieces and place them on the Professional Development Start square. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then take turns rolling the die to determine the turn order. The player who rolls the highest number will start. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="The player who rolled the highest should roll the die again and move their game piece clockwise around the game board according to the number they rolled. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When a player lands on a space on the game board, they draw the first card from the pile that corresponds to the type of space they landed on. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In this case, the player rolled a 4 and landed on the Activity space, so they will draw a card from the activity pile. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When a card is drawn, if there is a vacant square for that type on the lesson plan board, the player must place the card on one of the empty squares. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If there are no vacant squares for that type on the lesson plan board, the player can choose to discard the card they drew or replace a card of the same type on the lesson plan, placing the old card in the discard pile on the game board. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Cards must be placed on squares of the same type, i.e. activity card on activity square, assessment card on assessment square.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Players should discuss where they believe the activity or assessment would fit best, both in terms of the objective for a given session as well as the modality of the session (online or F2F). If there is any disagreement, the player who drew the card has the final decision where to place the card.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Once a player places their card on the lesson plan, their turn is over and the next player rolls the die and repeats this process.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Each card placed on the lesson plan will generate a certain amount of points. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Objective Cards are worth 2 points each.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Assessment cards are worth 8 points each, but ONLY if the level of Bloom’s Taxonomy matches the objective card in the same session. If the assessment card’s level for a given session does not match the objective card’s level, NO points will be added to the score for that session for the assessment card.Activity cards are worth 4 points each. If an activity card matches the level of the objective and assessment cards of a given session, add an additional 1 point to the value of that activity. Chance cards mimic the unexpected nature of teaching and can provide advantages and disadvantages to learning objectives, activities and assessments. Some chance cards will require that the player place the chance card on top of an activity on the lesson plan where other chance cards may require a player to discard an activity, assessment or objective and the chance card. Some chance cards will have an effect, but do not require the card to be placed on the lesson plan. If a chance card is drawn, after carrying out the effect of the card, place it in the discard pile.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="There are a total of 25 possible points for each session on the lesson plan. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When the time is up, the game ends (even if the lesson plan is incomplete) and points for each session should be calculated, taking into account extra points for matching levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy as well as the effects of any chance cards. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="The scores for each session should be added together to calculate the total grade for the final exam (out of 100 points). 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If playing with multiple teams, the team with the highest score at the end wins.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="There are 4 special squares, one on each corner of the game board. They are the Professional Development Start square, the Conference Room square, the Coffee Break square, and the Mandatory Meeting square.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="There are 3 Professional Development spaces on the game board. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Professional Development spaces allow a player to draw one card from any pile (activity, assessment or chance). 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="In addition to drawing a card, the player can do one of 3 things before or after placing the card on the lesson plan: 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="27" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="ListNumberedAsArabic" ListTypeFormat="Period" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Switch the places of any 2 cards on the lesson plan board.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="27" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="ListNumberedAsArabic" ListTypeFormat="Period" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Remove one activity or assessment from the lesson plan board. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="27" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="ListNumberedAsArabic" ListTypeFormat="Period" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Salvage a card from the discard pile and swap it with a card on the lesson plan board - the swapped out card on the lesson plan should be placed in the discard pile. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="The Professional Development Start space is treated as a normal professional development square and players should follow the same rules when they land on it. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Nothing happens if a player passes the professional development start square without landing on it. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The Coffee Break square is a free space. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Players cannot draw a card on a coffee break.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The Conference Room (just visiting) square is a free space. Players are not penalized, but do not get to draw a card. 
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="If a player lands on the Mandatory Meeting square, they must move their game piece directly to the Conference Room square without drawing a card. Then they must skip their next turn. After they have skipped 1 turn, they may resume playing normally starting from the Conference Room square.
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="There are also 2 special Chance cards. The Urgent Phone Call card and the Academic Freedom card.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The Urgent Phone Call chance card can save a player from skipping the next turn after being sent to the conference room. They still must move to the conference room and may not draw a card on upon landing on the Mandatory Meeting square. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="When a player draws this card from the Chance pile, they may hold onto it until they need to use it. This card can be transferred to save a colleague from a mandatory meeting but can only be used once. 
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The Academic Freedom card can be used as an activity or assessment of any level of Bloom’s Taxonomy. It must be placed in an empty space and be treated as a normal activity or assessment card. There are 2 Academic Freedom cards in the Chance card deck. 
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="You have 10 minutes to select your objectives and then 30 minutes to create the most effective lesson plan for Professor Bloom. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Good luck! Your time starts now!" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
